instruction: Which department offers Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology courses at EWU?
response: The Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology (GEB) department at East West University offers courses related to genetic engineering, biotechnology, and related core and elective subjects.

instruction: What courses are offered in the GEB department?
response: The GEB department offers the following courses: 1) Basic Biochemistry (GEB 201) - 4 credits, 2) Animal Physiology (GEB 203) - 3 credits, 3) Fundamentals of Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology (GEB 302) - 3 credits, 4) GMOs, Biosafety Regulations and Environmental Management (GEB 408) - 3 credits, and 5) Current Topics in Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology (GEB 410) - 3 credits.

instruction: What are the core courses in the Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology department?
response: The core courses in the GEB department include: Basic Biochemistry (GEB 201), Animal Physiology (GEB 203), and Fundamentals of Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology (GEB 302). Each of these courses has no prerequisites.

instruction: Can you tell me about the elective courses in GEB?
response: The elective courses in the Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology department are: GMOs, Biosafety Regulations and Environmental Management (GEB 408) and Current Topics in Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology (GEB 410). Both are 3-credit courses and do not require any prerequisites.

instruction: How many credits is the Basic Biochemistry course?
response: The Basic Biochemistry course (GEB 201) carries 4 credits and is a core course with no prerequisites.

instruction: Do I need any prerequisites for GEB 302?
response: No prerequisites are required for Fundamentals of Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology (GEB 302). It is open to all students in the GEB program.

GEB 410, titled 'Current Topics in Genetic Engineering and Biotechnology', is an elective course that explores recent developments and research trends in the field. The course carries 3 credits and has no prerequisites.

instruction: Is Animal Physiology a required course in GEB?
response: Yes, Animal Physiology (GEB 203) is a core course in the Genetic Engineering & Biotechnology program, worth 3 credits, and it does not require any prior courses.

instruction: Tell me about GMOs and biosafety course in GEB.
response: The course GMOs, Biosafety Regulations and Environmental Management (GEB 408) is an elective in the GEB department. It focuses on genetically modified organisms, biosafety standards, and environmental management practices. The course is 3 credits and has no prerequisites.

instruction: How many credits do I need to take for elective courses in GEB?
response: The GEB department offers two elective courses: GEB 408 and GEB 410. Each is 3 credits, so if you take both electives, you would complete 6 credits from electives.
